intro: Oenothera prismatica var. tenuifolia, commonly known as the slenderleaf evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant belongs to the Onagraceae family and is known for its showy, tubular flowers that attract nocturnal pollinators such as moths. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soils. The species is noted for its adaptability to harsh conditions and its role in supporting local ecosystems.
